intro: Pleurothallis parvilabia, commonly known as the small-lipped pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on trees, drawing moisture and nutrients from the air and rain. The plant features delicate, linear leaves and produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pale yellow. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is known for its intricate floral structure. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
